definition.name: NXapm_paraprobe_results_ranger

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n_ions
symbol.doc: The total number of ions in the reconstruction.

symbol.name: n_ivec_max
symbol.doc: Maximum number of allowed atoms per (molecular) ion (fragment). Needs to match maximum_number_of_atoms_per_molecular_ion.

definition.doc: Results of a paraprobe-ranger tool run.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version specifier of this application definition.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema with which this file was written.

field.name: program
field.doc: Given name of the program/software/tool with which this NeXus (configuration) file was generated.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Ideally program version plus build number, or commit hash or description of ever persistent resources where the source code of the program and build instructions can be found so that the program can be configured ideally in such a manner that the result of this computational process is recreatable in the same deterministic manner.

field.name: analysis_identifier
field.doc: Ideally, a (globally persistent) unique identifier for referring to this analysis.

field.name: analysis_description
field.doc: Possibility for leaving a free-text description about this analysis.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the analysis behind this results file was started, i.e. the paraprobe-tool executable started as a process.

field.name: end_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the analysis behind this results file were completed and the paraprobe-tool executable exited as a process.

field.name: config_filename
field.doc: The path and name of the config file for this analysis.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: At least SHA256 strong hash of the specific config_file for tracking provenance.

field.name: results_path
field.doc: Path to the directory where the tool should store NeXus/HDF5 results of this analysis. If not specified results will be stored in the current working directory.

field.name: status
field.doc:
A statement whether the paraprobe-tool executable managed to process the analysis or failed prematurely.
This status is written to the results file after the end_time at which point the executable must not compute any analysis. Only when this status message is present and shows `success`, the user should consider the results. In all other cases it might be that the executable has terminated prematurely or another error occurred.

group.doc: If used, contact information and eventually details of at least the person who performed this analysis.
Details about the coordinate system conventions used.

The individual coordinate systems which should be used. Field names should be prefixed with the following controlled terms indicating which individual coordinate system is described:
* paraprobe * lab * specimen * laser * leap * detector * recon

group.name: apply_existent_ranging
group.doc: Paraprobe-ranger loads the iontypes and evaluates for each ion on which iontype it matches. If it matches on none, the ion is considered of the default unknown type with a 0 as its respective value in the iontypes array.

field.name: maximum_number_of_atoms_per_molecular_ion
field.doc: The length of the isotope_vector used to describe molecular ions.

field.name: iontypes
field.doc: The iontype ID for each ion that was best matching, stored in the order of the evaporation sequence ID. The here computed iontypes do not take into account the charge state of the ion which is equivalent to interpreting a RNG and RRNG range files for each ion in such a way that only the elements of which a (molecular) ion is build are considered. By contrast, charged_iontypes takes into account also the charge state.

group.name: window
group.doc: A bitmask which identifies exactly all those ions ranged irrespective the type they ended up with.

field.name: number_of_ions
field.doc: Number of ions covered by the mask. The mask value for most may be 0.

field.name: bitdepth
field.doc: Number of bits assumed matching on a default datatype. (e.g. 8 bits for a C-style uint8).

field.name: mask
field.doc: The unsigned integer array representing the content of the mask. If padding is used the padded bits are set to 0. The mask is for convenience always as large as the entire dataset as it will be stored compressed anyway. The convenience feature with this is that then the mask can be decoded with numpy and mirrored against the evaporation_id array and one immediately can filter out all points that were used by the paraprobe. The length of the array adds to the next unsigned integer if the number of ions in the dataset is not an integer multiple of the bitdepth.

group.name: molecular_ion_search
group.doc: Paraprobe-ranger performs a combinatorial search over all possible or a reduced set of nuclids to identify into which ions these can be composed.

field.name: isotope_vector_matrix
field.doc: The main result is the list of molecular ions, here formatted according to the definitions of a set of isotope_vectors as detailed in :ref:`NXion`.

field.name: mass_to_charge_state_ratio
field.doc: The mass-to-charge-state ratio of each molecular ion without considering relativistic or quantum effects.

field.name: mass
field.doc: The mass of each molecular ion without considering relativistic or quantum effects.

field.name: charge_state
field.doc: The charge_state of each molecular ion.

field.name: natural_abundance_product
field.doc: The product of the natural abundance of the isotopes building each molecular ion. Further details are available in :ref:`NXapm_paraprobe_config_ranger`.

field.name: composition_product
field.doc: The product of the natural abundance of the isotopes building each molecular ion. Further details are available in :ref:`NXapm_paraprobe_config_ranger`.

field.name: number_of_disjoint_nuclids
field.doc: The number of disjoint nuclids for each molecular ion.

field.name: number_of_nuclids
field.doc: The number of nuclids for each molecular ion.

group.name: check_existent_ranging
group.doc: Paraprobe-ranger loads iontypes and evaluates for each ion on which iontype it matches. If it matches on none, the ion is considered of the default unknown type with a 0 as its respective value in the iontypes array. In contrast to use_existent_ranging this process does neither needs measured ion position nor mass-to-charge-state ratio values.

field.name: maximum_number_of_atoms_per_molecular_ion
field.doc: The length of the isotope_vector used to describe molecular ions.

field.name: number_of_processes
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_processes in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_threads
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_gpus
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.
